page.title: 08St.Nicholas Church/Bells
page.content: In June l985 St. Nicholas's Church held a flower festival to celebrate the three hundredth anniversary of the hanging of the bells. Flower festivals are popular in this area and the arrangements at this one depicted the Bells, The Apostles, St. Nicholas and Christ. The history of one bell is shrouded in mystery, for though it bears the date l07l there are doubts abouts its true age. The bell was moved from Middle Littleton Church, where it had probably hung above the altar and was then taken to St. Michael's Church, South Littleton. Now the bell has been renovated, but because it was cracked for many years, is still not rung. The tower contains six bells, installed in l685,which have decorative asabesque borders between the words inscribed upon them.
